about.title: About Pawsitive Pet Spa
about.body: Founded in 2017, Pawsitive Pet Spa is a family-owned business dedicated to providing the highest quality grooming with love and care. Our certified groomers have extensive training in breed-specific cuts, safe handling techniques, and stress-reduction methods. We use only premium, pet-safe products and maintain the highest standards of cleanliness and safety. Your pet's comfort and well-being are our top priorities.
about.subtitle: Why pets love us
features: üíé One pet at a time focus

items.text: My poodle looks amazing every time! The groomers are so gentle and patient with her. She actually gets excited when we pull up to the spa now. Highly recommend!
items.author: Sarah Johnson

items.text: Our cat hates baths, but the team here is incredible. They're patient, gentle, and know exactly how to handle anxious cats. Our kitty came home calm and beautiful!
items.author: Michael Chen

items.text: Best grooming experience ever! They listen to what you want and deliver perfect results. The spa day package is worth every penny. My dog was so relaxed and happy!
items.author: Amanda Rodriguez

members.name: Rachel Thompson
members.title: Master Groomer & Owner
members.bio: With 15 years of grooming experience and certifications in multiple breed-specific cuts, Rachel founded Pawsitive to create a stress-free grooming environment where every pet is treated with love and respect.

members.name: David Martinez
members.title: Senior Groomer
members.bio: David specializes in large breeds and dogs with special needs. His calm demeanor and expert handling make him a favorite among anxious pets and their owners.

members.name: Emily Park
members.title: Cat Grooming Specialist
members.bio: Emily is our feline expert, trained in low-stress handling techniques that make grooming a positive experience for even the most reluctant cats.

items.name: Fear-Free Certified
items.description: Stress-Free Handling

items.name: Certified Groomers
items.description: Professional Training

items.question: Do I need to stay during grooming?
items.answer: No need! Most pets are calmer without their owners present. We'll call when your pet is ready for pickup, usually 2-3 hours later.

items.question: What if my pet is anxious or aggressive?
items.answer: We're experienced with anxious and reactive pets. We use fear-free handling techniques and take breaks as needed. For extremely anxious pets, we may recommend shorter sessions or discuss alternative options.

items.question: What should I bring to the appointment?
items.answer: Just bring your pet on a leash or in a carrier! We provide everything else. If your pet has special dietary needs or medical conditions, please let us know in advance.

items.question: How often should my pet be groomed?
items.answer: It depends on breed and coat type. Most dogs benefit from grooming every 4-8 weeks. We'll provide a personalized recommendation based on your pet's needs.

items.question: Do you groom senior pets?
items.answer: Yes! We take extra care with senior pets, providing frequent breaks, gentle handling, and accommodations for mobility issues or health concerns.

items.question: What if my pet's coat is matted?
items.answer: We can carefully remove mats when possible. Severe matting may require shaving for your pet's comfort and safety. There may be an additional charge depending on severity.

items.question: Do you offer puppy/kitten grooming?
items.answer: Absolutely! We offer special introductory grooming for puppies and kittens to create positive associations with grooming from an early age.

items.question: What products do you use?
items.answer: We use premium, pet-safe products including organic shampoos and conditioners. We can accommodate sensitive skin and allergies with hypoallergenic options.
